intro: Symplocos incahuasensis, commonly known as the Incahuasensis waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Symplocos incahuasensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in local ecosystems.
